__e: Mr. Darcy, who never looked on any woman but to find blemish, and probably never looked on you in his life- put forward by Mr. Collins as your suitor.
The church ought to have been my profession. And, would have been if Mr. Darcy hadn't chosen to disregard his father's will.
Maybe that's the reason Mark Darcy and I never made it.
Miss Bingley sees that her brother is in love with you, but wants him to marry miss Darcy, and so writes you such a letter.
Mr. Darcy is so very careful where he goes.
When I asked after her brother, she made it clear that he knows of my being in town, but is much engaged at present with Mr Darcy and his sister.
